intro: Lippia polygalifolia, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves and small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. Lippia polygalifolia is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in humid climates.
